intro: Phyllanthus profusus, commonly known as the Indian cheesewood, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, often waxy leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive, almost heart-shaped appearance. Phyllanthus profusus is also noted for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
